name: Multiply Any Number by 11
latex: \text{For } ab \times 11: \text{ add digits, insert sum in middle}
explanation: To multiply a two-digit number by 11, add the two digits together and place the sum between them. If the sum is 10 or greater, carry the 1 to the left digit. For larger numbers, work from right to left, adding adjacent digits. This trick works because 11 = 10 + 1, so multiplying by 11 is like multiplying by 10 and adding the original number.
